description.zh-cn: 指中华民国建国初期，以京兆地方为首都的中央政府。因大总统和国务总理主要由北洋军阀出身而得名。
description.en: Refers to the central government of the Republic of China in its early days, with its capital in Jingzhao (Beijing). It was named after the Beiyang warlords who predominantly held the positions of President and Premier.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国第一任正式大总统，北洋军的创始者。
description.en: The first formal President of the Republic of China and the founder of the Beiyang Army.

description.zh-cn: 由中国国民党建立的中华民国政府，在北伐成功后取代北洋政府成为中国的执政当局。
description.en: The government of the Republic of China established by the Kuomintang, which replaced the Beiyang government as the ruling authority in China after the success of the Northern Expedition.

description.zh-cn: 指张学良宣布东北服从国民政府，将北洋政府的五色旗更换为国民政府的青天白日满地红旗的事件，标志着北洋政府的终结和国民政府在名义上统一中国。
description.en: Refers to Zhang Xueliang's announcement of the Northeast's allegiance to the Nationalist Government, replacing the Beiyang government's Five-Colored Flag with the Nationalist Government's Blue Sky, White Sun, and Wholly Red Earth flag. It marked the end of the Beiyang government and the nominal unification of China under the Nationalist Government.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国将领，奉系军阀首领张作霖之子，发动东北易帜。
description.en: A general of the Republic of China, son of Fengtian clique leader Zhang Zuolin, who initiated the Northeast Flag Replacement.

description.zh-cn: 由国民政府发起，旨在推翻北洋政府统治、统一中国的军事行动。
description.en: A military campaign launched by the Nationalist Government aimed at overthrowing the Beiyang government and unifying China.

description.zh-cn: 奉系军阀首领，北洋政府最后一任国家元首。
description.en: Leader of the Fengtian clique and the last head of state of the Beiyang government.

description.zh-cn: 日本关东军策划的针对奉系军阀首领张作霖的暗杀事件。
description.en: An assassination plot engineered by the Japanese Kwantung Army targeting Zhang Zuolin, leader of the Fengtian clique.

description.zh-cn: 东亚国家，在北洋政府时期对中国政治有重要影响。
description.en: An East Asian country that had a significant influence on Chinese politics during the Beiyang government period.

description.zh-cn: 由袁世凯筹备建立的君主立宪制国家，但最终未能正式成立。
description.en: A constitutional monarchy planned and established by Yuan Shikai, which ultimately failed to be formally realized.

description.zh-cn: 由蔡锷等人组织，旨在反对袁世凯称帝的军事力量。
description.en: A military force organized by Cai E and others to oppose Yuan Shikai's attempt to become emperor.

description.zh-cn: 由孙中山在日本成立的革命政党，是中国国民党的前身之一，反对袁世凯的统治。
description.en: A revolutionary political party founded by Sun Yat-sen in Japan, a predecessor of the Kuomintang, which opposed the rule of Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 一场以青年学生为主的爱国运动，起因于巴黎和会对山东问题的处理，对中国近代史产生深远影响。
description.en: A patriotic movement led by young students, sparked by the handling of the Shandong Problem at the Paris Peace Conference, which had a profound impact on modern Chinese history.

description.zh-cn: 第一次世界大战后协约国与德国签订的和平条约，其中关于山东问题的条款引发了中国的五四运动。
description.en: The peace treaty signed between the Allied Powers and Germany after World War I, whose clauses concerning the Shandong Problem triggered the May Fourth Movement in China.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事将领，直系军阀，后成为西北军领袖，曾发动甲子政变。
description.en: A military general of the Republic of China, a warlord of the Zhili clique, who later became the leader of the Northwestern Army and launched the Beijing Coup.

description.zh-cn: 由冯玉祥发动的军事政变，推翻了时任大总统曹锟的统治。
description.en: A military coup launched by Feng Yuxiang that overthrew the government of then-President Cao Kun.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事将领，直系军阀首领，曾通过贿选当选为中华民国大总统。
description.en: A military general of the Republic of China, leader of the Zhili clique, who was elected President of the Republic of China through bribery.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家，中华民国国父，中国国民党创始人。
description.en: A modern Chinese democratic revolutionary, the founding father of the Republic of China, and the founder of the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国初期政治家，国民党代理理事长，在即将出任内阁总理时被暗杀。
description.en: A statesman in the early Republic of China and acting chairman of the Kuomintang, who was assassinated shortly before he was to become premier.

description.zh-cn: 由孙中山等人发动的反对袁世凯统治的武装斗争，但很快以失败告终。
description.en: An armed struggle launched by Sun Yat-sen and others against Yuan Shikai's rule, which quickly ended in failure.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国军事家、政治家，皖系军阀首领，曾多次担任国务总理和临时执政。
description.en: A military strategist and statesman of the Republic of China, leader of the Anhui clique, who served multiple times as Premier and Provisional Chief Executive.

description.zh-cn: 指大总统府与国务院之间的权力斗争，核心人物是总统黎元洪和总理段祺瑞，主要围绕是否参与第一次世界大战等问题展开。
description.en: Refers to the power struggle between the Presidential Palace and the State Council, with key figures being President Li Yuanhong and Premier Duan Qirui, primarily centered on issues such as whether to participate in World War I.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家，曾两次担任大总统。
description.en: A statesman of the Republic of China who served as President twice.

description.zh-cn: 由张勋策动的清朝复辟事件，但仅持续了12天便以失败告终。
description.en: An attempt to restore the Qing dynasty orchestrated by Zhang Xun, which failed after only 12 days.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯当选为首任中华民国大总统，象征着北洋政府的正式成立。
description.en: Yuan Shikai's election as the first President of the Republic of China symbolized the formal establishment of the Beiyang government.

description.zh-cn: 国民政府发起的北伐战争导致北洋军战败，最终使北洋政府瓦解。
description.en: The Northern Expedition launched by the Nationalist Government led to the defeat of the Beiyang Army and the eventual collapse of the Beiyang government.

description.zh-cn: 张学良宣布服从国民政府，标志着北洋政府正式退出历史舞台。
description.en: Zhang Xueliang's announcement of allegiance to the Nationalist Government marked the official exit of the Beiyang government from the stage of history.

description.zh-cn: 在父亲张作霖被炸死后，张学良继承政权并宣布东北易帜。
description.en: After his father Zhang Zuolin was killed in a bombing, Zhang Xueliang inherited power and declared the Northeast Flag Replacement.

description.zh-cn: 北洋政府末代元首张作霖在撤退途中，于皇姑屯事件中被日本军队炸死。
description.en: The last head of state of the Beiyang government, Zhang Zuolin, was killed by the Japanese army in the Huanggutun incident during his retreat.

description.zh-cn: 日本军队在皇姑屯策划并实施了针对张作霖的爆炸暗杀。
description.en: The Japanese military planned and executed the bombing assassination targeting Zhang Zuolin at Huanggutun.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯同意并筹备建立君主立宪制的中华帝国，但在多方反对下于1916年3月22日宣布撤销帝制。
description.en: Yuan Shikai agreed to and prepared for the establishment of the constitutional monarchy of the Empire of China, but announced the cancellation of the monarchy on March 22, 1916, amid widespread opposition.

description.zh-cn: 由蔡锷领导的护国军起兵反对袁世凯称帝，是导致帝制失败的主要军事力量之一。
description.en: The National Protection Army, led by Cai E, rose up against Yuan Shikai's attempt to become emperor, and was one of the main military forces that led to the failure of the monarchy.

description.zh-cn: 孙文领导的中华革命党参与了围剿袁世凯帝制的行动。
description.en: The Chinese Revolutionary Party, led by Sun Yat-sen, participated in the campaign against Yuan Shikai's monarchy.

description.zh-cn: 五四运动因抗议巴黎和会对山东问题的处理，导致北洋政府代表最终未在《凡尔赛条约》上签字。
description.en: The May Fourth Movement, protesting the handling of the Shandong Problem at the Paris Peace Conference, led to the Beiyang government's representatives ultimately not signing the Treaty of Versailles.

description.zh-cn: 冯玉祥发动甲子政变（又称北京政变），推翻了曹锟政府。
description.en: Feng Yuxiang launched the Jiazi Coup (also known as the Beijing Coup), overthrowing Cao Kun's government.

description.zh-cn: 曹锟在甲子政变中被推翻，其大总统统治被终结。
description.en: Cao Kun was overthrown in the Jiazi Coup, ending his rule as president.

description.zh-cn: 孙中山多次公开批评北洋政府为官僚武人所把持的“假民国”，认为其未能实现革命目的。
description.en: Sun Yat-sen repeatedly and publicly criticized the Beiyang government as a 'fake republic' controlled by bureaucrats and militarists, believing it failed to achieve revolutionary goals.

description.zh-cn: 即将出任内阁总理的国民党代理理事长宋教仁被暗杀，此事被普遍认为是袁世凯所指使。
description.en: Song Jiaoren, the acting chairman of the Kuomintang who was about to become premier, was assassinated. It is widely believed that Yuan Shikai was behind the assassination.

description.zh-cn: 孙中山以宋教仁被刺及袁世凯进行“善后大借款”为由，发动了反对袁世凯的二次革命。
description.en: Citing the assassination of Song Jiaoren and Yuan Shikai's 'Reorganization Loan,' Sun Yat-sen launched the Second Revolution against Yuan.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯的北洋军迅速镇压了二次革命，导致其以失败告终。
description.en: Yuan Shikai's Beiyang Army quickly suppressed the Second Revolution, leading to its failure.

description.zh-cn: 在府院之争中，总统黎元洪请督军张勋入京调解，直接酿成了张勋复辟事件。
description.en: During the conflict between the Presidential Palace and the State Council, President Li Yuanhong invited warlord Zhang Xun to Beijing to mediate, which directly led to the Zhang Xun Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 在府院之争中，大总统黎元洪解除了段祺瑞的国务总理职务。
description.en: During the conflict between the Presidential Palace and the State Council, President Li Yuanhong dismissed Duan Qirui from his position as Premier.

position.en: Generalissimo of the Army and Navy

description.zh-cn: 张作霖在北京就任陆海军大元帅，成立中华民国军政府（安国军政府），成为北洋政府最后一任国家元首。
description.en: Zhang Zuolin assumed the post of Generalissimo of the Army and Navy in Beijing, establishing the Military Government of the Republic of China (Anguojun Government), becoming the last head of state of the Beiyang government.
